itemDescription: founder and chief executive of British websites Mumsnet and Gransnet

wikipedia_page.main: Justine Juliette Alice Roberts  (born October 1967) is the founder and chief executive of British websites Mumsnet and Gransnet.

response: *Justine Roberts, founder and chief executive of Mumsnet
Mumsnet is a London-based internet forum, created in 2000 by Justine Roberts for discussion between parents of children and teenagers.

Mumsnet was created by Justine Roberts in 2000, who came up with the idea of a website to help parents pool information and advice, following a disastrous first family holiday with her one-year-old twins. Once back in the UK, Roberts persuaded friends Carrie Longton and Steven Cassidy to help her build the site.

In November 2010, Mumsnet co-founder Justine Roberts wrote to Prime Minister David Cameron, urging reform of the draft Defamation Bill to address the rise of online publication.Open letter to David Cameron Mumsnet
|Justine Roberts, founder of Mumsnet, a website for parents
